content: Added the words "average of" in Goal section to clarify the requirement.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fast and simple little CoC.
Also like the shortest mode, as there is some optimization possible
我认为该谜题可行性强。

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Le problème qui subsistait en python a été réglé.

I think it is a good one, but the draw case sometimes lead to a different result :
because of float coding in python, equality is false and comparison gives a winner and not a draw.
I'm not sure it is the thing you wanted to test, if I try to understand your C# code.
Maybe you need to change test3.

Not working :

team_1 = map(float,input().split(";"))
team_2 = map(float,input().split(";"))
un = sum(team_1)
deux=sum(team_2)
if un>deux:
    print("team1")
elif deux >un :
    print("team2")
else :
    print("draw")

Working :

team_1 = map(float,input().split(";"))
team_2 = map(float,input().split(";"))
un = sum(team_1)
deux=sum(team_2)
if abs(un - deux) < 0.00001: #Here is the issue
    print("draw")
elif deux >un :
    print("team2")
else :
    print("team1")

Thank you very much for the feedback. 
I have updated test 3 to make sure that there is no problem validating the draw case in Python.

Works now for me in python no problem:
a,b=[sum(map(float,input().split(";")))for _ in[1,2]]
w=1if a>b else 2
print("draw"if a==b else f'team{w}')

nice little CoC
